summary:
Forward thinking Electro-Mechanical Engineer with proven track record in the semiconductor industry. A communicative, pragmatic and proactive leader, who works efficiently in environments where time management is essential. Skilled on electro-magnetic actuator design and high precision engineering.

awards.title: Formula Student 2015 Certificate
awards.description:
2015 Formula Student certificate of participation by the Institution of Mechanical Engineers on 9-12 July 2015, Silverstone Circuit, UK.

As a member of the Dynamics Software Team, the whole powertrain system was developed using two ENSTROJ Permanent Magnet Synchronous Motors [PMSM] connected with two UNITEK Bamocar D3 controllers . Both devices were managed by a NI Compact RIO [C-RIO] Field Programmable Gate Array [FPGA] module. In addition, and Electric Differential was developed using NI LabVIEW 2014 to simulate the Ackerman's angle. The input data was the throttle position and the steering angle.

certifications.name: PSE certification: FEA (Standard Level), MESM (Advanced Level)
Siemens NX 11 Simcenter 3D Custom Design Simulation
Fundamentals of Audio and Music Engineering: Part 1 Musical Sound & Electronics

projects.title: imPulse
projects.description:
The aim of this project is to provide a cost-effective alternative to power generation on bikes using conventional stepper motors while adding other capabilities, such as: 

- An integrated data logging system to monitor power generated on each trip. 

- A smart lighting system with addressable LEDs, working as indicators, braking lights and headlights, incorporating Light Dependant Resistors (LDRs) to sense the environment and to reduce the risk of glare. 

- Power Distribution Board (PDB) to charge two different/generic powerbanks. While one powerbank is charged, the other one is used to supply energy to the system. 

Please bear in mind that I am currently testing quick prototypes that may compromise the bike reliability in some cases (aka 'learn by doing'). No stress, compression, bending or torsion analysis have been carried out yet on the power generation stage, so use all this project content at your own risk.

profile_positions.description:
I am responsible for the design and implementation of actuators, working together with architects, lead engineers, team leaders and designers, to enable a reliable, stable, safe, contamination free, cost effective and easy-to-manufacture end-product.

I am also part of the Magnet Competence, where advice is provided about different magnetic configurations within a design, magnet stacking/placement techniques, magnet surface treatments, glue adhesion performance at mono-magnet level, and general advice.

About my current role:

- Specifies and designs the precision parts for different actuators applying high precision engineering principles.

- Delegates different design tasks to other design engineers, by giving clear goals and realistic deadlines, in line with the project timeline.

- Has knowledge of the different manufacturing processes of actuators, including new emerging technologies (e.g., AM).

- Is responsible of the design and qualification of the different tests (e.g., dynamic qualification) and tools (e.g., design/qualification dedicated tools) dealing with relevant stakeholders and ensuring that designs meet specifications in time.

- Aligns with suppliers and stakeholders accordingly, in order to ensure a smooth and stable product realization, according to the project timeline.

- Is responsible for the technical product documentation.
profile_positions.title: Mechanical Design Engineer

profile_positions.description: Great people/company that I am working for. Thanks to this company I currently work for ASML and I also had the chance to meet amazing professionals within my field of interest in The Netherlands!
profile_positions.title: Mechanical Design Engineer

profile_positions.description:
Research project: Design And Control of a Magnetic Levitation System for High-Speed Rotary Applications

Uncountable mathematical models and FEA analysis have been carried out using well-known software, such as Matlab & Simulink and MapleSoft. CAD models have been designed for different test rigs assemblies based on previous modelling in SolidWorks, taking into account API, ISO and BS standards. Deep understanding in electric and electronics has also been a key point for the test rig design. High power amplifiers and a dSpace controller were used in this setup where different control strategies are being tested (e.g. PID, ROLAC, OLAC and Deep Learning).
profile_positions.title: Researcher

profile_positions.description:
2016 - 2017

My role as a GTA is to teach Graduate and MSc students. Topics covered during the academic term involved Electronics, Magnetism, Calculus, CAD design and FEA analysis with SolidWorks, motion simulation analysis with SIEMENS NX, dynamics modelling and control with Matlab & Simulink and control theories applied to different with the QUANSER CUBE.

Regarding the practical side, it was also possible for me to teach Motorsport and Automotive students. The main subject covered was the data acquisition and analysis through the CAN bus communication system of a vehicle. 

First, basic concepts about ABS, ASR, EDS and ESP were explained using the THEPRA pro line bench. Second, the students tried to retrieve data from a Renault Mégane and a Lotus Exige from their respective ODB and also directly from sensors. To perform these tasks Arduino and also a professional device (PicoScope) were utilised.

2017 - 2018

My role as a GTA is to teach Graduate and MSc students. Modules covered during this academic year were Electronics applied to Aeronautical Engineering with LJ Create Tools, Materials Engineering, Technical Drawing and CAD with Solidworks, Motion Analysis with Siemens NX, Control Systems with Embedded Implementation using Freescale, LabView and MyRIO from NI Labs for the coursework and Matlab and Simulink for State Space Design, Control Theory and a little bit of Artificial Intelligence .

2018 - 2019

Last year! This year I have also decided to teach Fluid Mechanics! New automotive rigs have been carefully studied and now they are fundamental for the Automotive students. There are two Ford rigs with basic sensors and actuators (petrol and diesel) and a Volkswagen CAN rig. My aim is to show students how different communications systems work on a car and why they are used and how to retrieve, process and filter signals from different sensor in a car.
profile_positions.title: Graduate Teaching Assistant

profile_positions.description:
2017 - 2018

Our team is growing! After an amazing season full of new experiences with last KU motorsport team, we are now getting ready for our next challenge! This year, new toys and new modifications are applied to the car. I am taking part of a big project: the design of a variable length manifold air intake system. 

Unfortunately, we did not have enough time to implement the system due to some issues with new upgrades. However, my colleague Eddy and me managed to almost finish it completely by designing an in-house air-box, trumpets, linear screw mechanism and its respective controller. Check pictures below!

2016-2017 

The main aim of this project is to take part of this exciting competition. As a member of the Kingston University Motorsport Team, my aim is to redesign the electronics of the car, adding some new "toys" such as the Race Tech. DL1 SPORT data logger, DASH2 dashboard and also the EMU Black ECU.
profile_positions.title: KU Motorsport Design Engineer
SEC Conference 2018 Committee - Leader in Communication Team

profile_positions.description:
My role as a Mechatronics Leader is to design and prepare lessons for children using a very tiny, but well known, powerful and versatile micro-controller (MCU), Arduino.

My personal goal with this 1-year course is to bring Electronics and Mechanical Design to children. This involves the design of every lesson/concept in a very creative and attractive way. I have to say that it is a challenge. Every single student is completely different and shows you different points of view when dealing with a problem.

All in all, I am trying to teach what I had to learn by myself during my childhood. It is amazing to observe their expressions when you demonstrate that they can design almost everything using LEDs, potentiometers, push-buttons, photo-resistors, etc.

2018 - 2019
I had the chance to design another course for the upcoming year. This course will be divided into three terms: Introduction to Mechatronics with Arduino, Autonomous Ground Vehicle and Robotic Arm. If you want to know more about it, please check Richer's Education webpage and I hope you like/enjoy it!
profile_positions.title: Mechatronics Leader

profile_positions.description:
As a part of the Robotics Team at Richer Education, my role is to teach, help and motivate students when building their fancy LEGO EV3 projects. Each project is comprehended by a building and also a programming stage. In other words, we help students to develop their creativity, programming skills, problem solving capabilities, teamwork and social skills.

All in all, our aim is to make sure that every single student learn while enjoying each session.
profile_positions.title: Robotics Mentor

First, new students were interested on starting a degree or a master in the university.

profile_positions.company: Universidad de Las Palmas de Gran Canaria
profile_positions.description:
As a researcher, my role was to design and develop computational models using different human bones. The process followed is explained below:

- A CT scan was retrieved from medical authorities.
- 3D Doctor was used to detect different areas of the bone from each image and to create the complex geometry.
- SolidWorks was chosen to create the mesh of the model and to execute boolean operations. Only then it was possible to define the trabecular and cortical bone models, respectively.
- Abaqus was the final goal, as it is a very powerful tool for FEA.
profile_positions.title: Undergraduate Researcher
